line: This woman claims to have been taken aboard a spaceship and held in an anti-gravity chamber without food and water for three days.

line: 1947, family watches dad get dragged off into the woods, cops find dad with a few appendages gnawed off. Cops corner a large naked man in the woods and gun `im down. Autopsy shows human flesh and bones in the man's large intestine. A beast man. Requisition for a car please.

line: I heard the same story when I was a kid too, funny thing is, I believed it. Thanks Doreen. Fact is, we got a cannibalised body in New Jersey, someone or something out there is hungry.

line: Well, it's hard to tell. CORONER'S DEPARTMENT NAME CROCKETT ROGER CASE NO. 2272

speaker: RANGER PETER BOULAY
line: Found the body just over there, lying face down in the rocks. Thirty-two years with the park service, I've come across some weird stuff but I tell ye, never anything like this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Victim was a homeless man, you get many of them wandering around out here?

line: Well like I said, now thirty-two years, I see alot of weird stuff. Like one time, a little over four years ago, I saw what I thought was a, large man come out of a, copse of birch trees, not, not a stitch of clothing. And he was about, sixty yards away, and he starts, sniffing the air, you know like a dog. And then he looks straight at me, and I swear he smelled me because he took off into the woods so fast, you'd swear it wasn't human.

speaker: MULDER
line: Really. You never saw him again?

speaker: RANGER PETER BOULAY
line: No, but I feel him. And, I found things, some scat, half buried like a cat's only more human. Found a half eaten rabbit with what looked like a human cuspid tooth in it. And some deer bones, looked like they'd been sharpened into tools.

speaker: DR. DIAMOND
line: Just about every culture has one. Yetis, Sasquatch, Russian Almas, Dsonoqua.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why is that?

speaker: DR. DIAMOND
line: Oh, it's a kind of universal wild man myth. A symbolic fear of our dual natures as humans, as creators of life and destroyers of it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's this chart?

speaker: DR. DIAMOND
line: It shows the historic entry of man onto each continent and the effect it had on other animal species, which as you see has been disastrous.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: DR. DIAMOND
line: Well, we humans have retained hereditary traits through evolution that have proven to be extremely destructive. We tend to be tribal and aggressively territorial, oriented by selfish sexual and reproductive drives that make, co-operation beyond the family-a-tribe, extremely hard for us.

speaker: MULDER
line: So we kill other species in order to survive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, humans are top carnivores, we sit at the top of the food chain and we, reduce other species' chance of survival.

speaker: DR. DIAMOND
line: Nice to know Dana left here with more than a degree.

speaker: MULDER
line: But what if something entered the food chain above us?

speaker: DR. DIAMOND
line: It won't happen, see our intelligence virtually insures us, barring the introduction of some alien life-form, we will live out our days as rulers of the world.

speaker: MULDER
line: But, but what if through some fluke of nature, a human was born, who reverted to it's most animal instincts, a kind of carnivorous neanderthal. Wouldn't he occupy a space above us on the food chain?

speaker: DR. DIAMOND
line: Oh sure, all he'd have to do is wait outside any fast-food restaurant and eat us on the way in.

line: Right, yeah, an.and, and haven't there been cases were, men have been raised in the wilderness by animals who have no language and hunt like predators?

line: Well maybe in the jungles of New Gineau or, it's just, highly unlikely that what you're suggesting could've survived civilization, a revolution, out in the woods of New Jersey.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMPSON
line: Can you see it?

speaker: S.W.A.T. TEAM OFFICER
line: It crawled into the walls.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMPSON
line: Can you get a man in there?

speaker: S.W.A.T. TEAM OFFICER
line: That's affirmative.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMPSON
line: And keep these people outta here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You could take her alive.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMPSON
line: What's going on in there?

speaker: S.W.A.T. TEAM OFFICER
line: I got a man down, I got a naked woman just jumped from a second storey window. Suspect is headed south into the woods on foot.

speaker: RANGER PETER BOULAY
line: I know these woods, if she's going for cover, she'll be down by the rocks. Look.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you reach her from here?

speaker: RANGER PETER BOULAY
line: I can try.

speaker: VOICES
line: I got it. Up ahead. I got it. She tried to take my arm off. Watch it right here. Right there. Looks like she was trying to bury herself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why did you have to kill her?

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMPSON
line: Same reason you kill a rabid animal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, this just came through, it's the posthumous medical exam on the woman's body. They found fragments of human bones still in her digestive tract, they estimated her age to be twenty-five to thirty years. Now they allowed Dr. Diamond to do a medical exam of the body but he found nothing that suggested prehistoric bone structure or physiology. Now the ACPD has her listed as a Jane Doe, and a search for her identity in state psychiatric records has begun, in earnest.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good luck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They have also released the medical exam from the male body that they found, his age is estimated to be about forty years.

speaker: MULDER
line: There would have been offspring.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The medical exam of the women's uterus does seem to indicate that she may have given birth.

speaker: MULDER
line: She was just protecting her children Scully, it all makes sense. The male dies and she comes out of the woods in search of food.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder will you do me a favour, will you just go out and have a beer, will you take the day off. I'll cover for you, will you just, take some time for yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks for the offer but I've got an appointment at the Smithsonian with.....an ethno-biologist, I can't wait to tell him about this. Mulder, yeah just a second, it's for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: ROB
line: Hi Dana, it's Rob.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh hi.

speaker: ROB
line: Sorry to call you at work, it's just I have Scott for the night and er, we have two extra tickets for Cirque De Soliel, we thought maybe you'd like to ask Ellen if you could take Trent and join us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Requisition for a car please Fran. Thank you. Who was that on the phone?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A guy.

speaker: MULDER
line: A guy. Same guy as the guy you had dinner with the other night?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Same guy.

speaker: MULDER
line: You gonna have dinner with him again?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think so.

speaker: MULDER
line: No interest?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not at this time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks Fran. What are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going with you to the Smithsonian.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't you have a life Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Keep that up Mulder and I'll hurt you like that beast-woman.

speaker: MULDER
line: Eight million years out of Africa.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look who's holding the door.

speaker: BOY
line: Dad, did you just see something down there?

speaker: DAD
line: Where?

speaker: BOY
line: Over there.

speaker: DAD
line: Naah, I'm sure it was nothing.

speaker: BOY
line: No, I saw something.

speaker: DAD
line: Hey, did you ever hear the story of the Jersey Devil? You know when I was a kid, my dad used to tell this story about a creature who lived out down the woods...
